title: [BUG] RConObserver results in a `TypeError: can't concat bytes to str` after upgrading to Python 3
body:
**Issue Description**
When attempting to use the `RConObserver` a `TypeError: can't concat bytes to str` error is thrown. This is likely to do with upgrading to Python 3.

**Full Stacktrace:**

```
*******************************************************************************
2019-07-06 19:38:37 E The traceback below will tell you which line triggered the error

*******************************************************************************
2019-07-06 19:38:37 E Partial traceback:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/overviewer_core/configParser.py", line 84, in parse
    rendermodes.__dict__, self._config_state)
  File "../config/serenity.py", line 88, in <module>
    rconObserver = RConObserver("server.host.ip.here", "rConPassword", rconPort)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/overviewer_core/observer.py", line 444, in __init__
    self.conn.login(password)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/overviewer_core/rcon.py", line 73, in login
    self.send(3, password)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/overviewer_core/rcon.py", line 43, in send
    data = header + payload + '\x00\x00'
TypeError: can't concat bytes to str
```

This can be achieved by simply supplying the following configuration option to any render operation:

```python
# RCon
rconObserver = RConObserver("server.host.ip.here", "rConPassword", rconPort)

observer = rconObserver
```

title: GenPOI: more than one filter gives TypeError: unorderable types: RegionSet() < RegionSet()
body:
Adding more than one filter function to the "markers" list results in the following crash:

```
2019-06-25 18:43:16 E An error has occurred. This may be a bug. Please let us know!
See http://docs.overviewer.org/en/latest/index.html#help

This is the error that occurred:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/bin/overviewer.py", line 650, in <module>
    ret = main()
  File "/usr/bin/overviewer.py", line 168, in main
    g.genPOI.main()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/overviewer_core/aux_files/genPOI.py", line 535, in main
    sfilters = sorted(filters, key=keyfunc)
TypeError: unorderable types: RegionSet() < RegionSet()
```

Here are the relevant parts of my config:

```
def signFilter(poi):
  if poi['id'] == 'minecraft:sign' and (
    'Postkasse' in poi['Text1'] or
    'Postkasse' in poi['Text2'] or
    'Postkasse' in poi['Text3'] or
    'Postkasse' in poi['Text4']):
      return "\n".join([poi['Text1'], poi['Text2'], poi['Text3'], poi['Text4']])

def portalFilter(poi):
  if poi['id'] == 'minecraft:sign' and (
    'Portal' in poi['Text1'] or
    'Portal' in poi['Text2'] or
    'Portal' in poi['Text3'] or
    'Portal' in poi['Text4']):
      return "\n".join([poi['Text1'], poi['Text2'], poi['Text3'], poi['Text4']])

renders["Slaskcraft_day"] = {
  "world": "Slaskcraft",
  "title": "Dag",
  "rendermode": "smooth_lighting",
  "dimension": "overworld",
  "markers": [dict(name="Postkasser", filterFunction=signFilter),
    dict(name="Portaler", filterFunction=portalFilter)]
}
```

Having just one filter works fine.

title: genPOI Ignores "crop"
body:
Basically the genPOI script ignores the "crop" setting for worlds and as a result searches through region files it doesn't need to to find entities. As a result it takes longer then it needs to.

For example in my setup I have the world and spawn within a 4096 block radius centered on  X=8192,Z=0, with regions generated in a 4096 block radius centred on X=0,Z=0 too. However I am only rendering the first of those areas, and as such have "crop" set to cover only half of the total area generated. However genPOI still checks all the generated chunks in the unrendered portion and adds markers there too.

title: Manual POI Icons positioned wrongly
body: Icons associated with manual POIs are anchored at the specified coordinates by their top-left corner, rather than the point at the bottom (or signpost, for the sign icon). Having this anchor point makes zooming look a little odd. Instead, I suggest that the anchoring be changed to be the same as the spawn and linked location POIs, which behave as expected.

title: JSObserver doesn't work with Leaflet
body:
Hi,

With google maps API the JSObserver could write the progress with ETA to the screen during generation on the lower right corner, but with Leaflet, the info is totally missing.

Settings to achieve this, which was working before Leaflet:

```
# Import the Observers
from observer import MultiplexingObserver, ProgressBarObserver, JSObserver

# Construct the ProgressBarObserver
ProgressBarObserver = ProgressBarObserver()

# Construct a basic JSObserver
jsObserver = JSObserver(outputdir, 30)

# Set the observer to a MultiplexingObserver
observer = MultiplexingObserver(ProgressBarObserver, jsObserver)
```

Dutch

title: Glazed Terracotta appears to need orientation handling
body:
**The Issue:**
Currently Overviewer does not appear to have orientation handling for Glazed Terracotta, as all GT blocks currently display the exact same texture regardless of orientation. Proper orientation rendering is how all those neat patterns occur, so here's the issue report. :smile: 

**The Explanation:**
_Full Disclaimer: First time trying to read python. Please advise if I'm off my rocker._
Glancing through the textures.py, it looks as I thought it might. Block orientation isn't even checked for unless specified, It looks like logs [have an orientation handling](https://github.com/overviewer/Minecraft-Overviewer/blob/39d588ae45d5e66f92e2c7b8923e5269e601f3b5/overviewer_core/textures.py#L1122), however glazed terracotta [does not](https://github.com/overviewer/Minecraft-Overviewer/blob/39d588ae45d5e66f92e2c7b8923e5269e601f3b5/overviewer_core/textures.py#L4680).

Glazed Terracotta displays it's textures differently, depending on the direction the block is facing, similarly to logs, but potentially with more detail (_north and south facing logs likely look largely the same, whereas north and south facing glazed terracotta do not_), so I suspect new code will need to be authored for G.T. blocks, or I would have dragged and dropped from logs or something similar.

title: Manual POIs are not generated unless specified for each renderer in a given RegionSet
body:
Hello,

It took me a long time to debug this strange issue. Consider the following ...

```
...
def strongholdFilter(poi):
    if poi['id'] == 'SH':
        poi["icon"] = "http://minecraft.3decibels.net/map/icons/marker_factory.png"
        return "Location of " + poi['name']
...
overworld_markers =  [{"name": "All players", "filterFunction": playerFilter, "checked": True}, {"name": "Strongholds", "filterFunction": strongholdFilter}, {"name": "Points of Interest", "filterFunction": signFilter}]
...
manualpois = [
  {"id": "SH",
   "x": 51*16,
   "y": 64,
   "z": -45*16,
   "name": "Stronghold A"},
  {"id": "SH",
   "x": -59*16,
   "y": 64,
   "z": -17*16,
   "name": "Stronghold B"},
  {"id": "SH",
   "x": 19*16,
   "y": 64,
   "z": 76*16,
   "name": "Stronghold C"}]
...
renders["normalrender"] = {
    "world": "SMP",
    "title": "Overworld",
    "rendermode": [Base(), Lighting(), EdgeLines()],
    "manualpois": manualpois,
    "markers": overworld_markers
}

renders["slimefinder"] = {
    "world": "SMP",
    "title": "Slime Chunks",
    "rendermode": [ClearBase(), SlimeOverlay()],
    "overlay": ["normalrender"]
}
...
```

The above does not generate the markers for the manualpois unless the maualpois are also added to the "slimefinder" render. This is because they are using the same regionset and the slimefinder's lack of manualpois overwrites/clobbers the manualpois already in the rset.

Working around the issue is simple. The manualpois must be set foreach renderer that shares the same RegionSet regardless of whether markers are specified.

Please let me know if you need more info.

~Mike

title: Overviewer crash during tile generation
body:
Since I updated Overviewer more than 2 weeks ago, Python crashes when trying to generate tiles on a freshly copied world folder. If I re-run Overviewer without copying the world, everything is fine.

Windows' Event Viewer tells me Python crashed in module c_overviewer.pyd with error 0xc000000e. I noticed the only thing that changed recently in C part of Overviewer is then Nether rendermode being updated by eminence's commit (dc345ba75db8fbd760740a6fcfa84d234dbdd965). When I reverted the changes (or used netherold rendermode instead of nether), Overviewer does its job without crashing.

I'd like to be able to put traces inside nether.c to know exactly where it crashes, but the printf I've put in there are not displaying in the console, so I can't give more details.

Can someone help me solve this issue? Thanks! :-)

title: Config file and stop work
body:
If i launch the software simply -> no problem.
if i launch with a config file, the soft has stopped working at 10%

my overviewer.py (config file)

worlds["temple"] = "e:/world"
worlds["chaos"] = "e:/world_nether"

renders["templeday"] = {
    "world": "temple",
    "title": "Daytime",
    "rendermode": smooth_lighting,
    "dimension": "overworld"
}

renders["templenight"] = {
    "world": "temple",
    "title": "Nighttime",
    "rendermode": smooth_night,
    "dimension": "overworld"
}

renders["chaos"] = {
    "world": "chaos",
    "title": "Nether",
    "rendermode": nether_smooth_lighting,
    "dimension": "nether"
}

outputdir = "e:/overviewer"

I wrote an error ?

title: Overviewer hangs during render.
body:
I was trying to render my maps and it got stuck. Waited two days and it is still stuck. Tried again with verbose output. Stopped working on

tileset.py:1110    29037 2012-12-08 17:45:50 DEBUG    Testing mtime for composite-tile /Users/minecraft/www/overview/survival_marc_01_n_s/3/3.png

and in the second try on

tileset.py:1110    29123 2012-12-08 18:33:22 DEBUG    Testing mtime for composite-tile /Users/minecraft/www/overview/unikn_survival_ow_total_night/0/3/3/3/3/3/3/3/0/3/1.png

These files however appear to be nothing out of the ordinary.

I have the most recent version of the overviewer. Any advice?

PS: I aborted the very first run and the first verbose run; this of course led to warnings about not being entirely sure what needs to be rendered; however, other than that there is no difference to the symptoms. Rebuilding the overviewer did not help.

title: createInfoWindow and existing configurations
body:
After updating to current HEAD, I needed to add createInfoWindow=True to get info windows for my POIs. 
Running genPOI immediately after update resulted in no info windows, just title text.

title: Overviewer Crashes when screen session is resized
body: paalbra has reported in the channel that if he resizes a terminal running a screen session of overviewer, overviewer fails. When rescaling a terminal with overviewer running directly, it works.
